author: Doug Bostrom
content:
Also see:

“Russia spoofed AIS data to fake British warship’s course days before Crimea guns showdown”

https://www.theregister.com/2021/06/24/russia_ais_spoofing/

People who hang out here know that a “ship” with AIS capable of running for several days could be stuffed in a backpack.

And the Russian MO: don’t care if the theatre is plausible under scrutiny; doubt is all that’s needed to paralyze. See MH 17: “There were no missiles and they were not our missiles and if they were they were stolen by Ukrainian partisans and anyway no jet was ever shot down.” Job done.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
What they have to remember is that they need British permission to transit the English Channel and are always escorted by RN warships.
What goes around comes around.
